intro: Leucas eriostoma var. eriostoma, commonly known as the hairy leucas, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Lamiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and shrubs. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine in some regions.
